title: Upper Intermediate German - Complex Structures & Nominalizations

questions.question: Was würdest du tun, wenn das Wasser aus der Wand laufen würde?
questions.englishTranslation: What would you do if water were running out of the wall? - I would call the caretaker immediately.
options: Ich würde sofort den Hausmeister rufen.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II with würde-form (conditional present)

questions.question: Der die Rechnung nicht bezahlende Mieter wurde gekündigt.
questions.englishTranslation: The tenant not paying the bill was evicted. - That was unfortunately necessary.
questions.explanation: Participle I clause (der...nicht bezahlende) as attribute

questions.question: Lässt sich das Problem nicht einfacher lösen?
questions.englishTranslation: Can't the problem be solved more simply? - Yes, but nobody wants to try.
options: Doch, aber niemand will es versuchen.
questions.explanation: sich lassen + Infinitiv (passive alternative)

questions.question: Während des Renovierens fielen uns viele Probleme auf.
questions.englishTranslation: During the renovating, we noticed many problems. - We had to spend more money.
questions.explanation: Nominalization of verb (das Renovieren) with genitive

questions.question: Hätte ich gewusst, dass es so kompliziert wird, würde ich nie angefangen haben.
questions.englishTranslation: Had I known it would become so complicated, I would never have started. - Now I regret it.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II perfect conditional with hätte...gewusst/würde...haben

questions.question: Der von mir reparierte Wasserhahn läuft wieder.
questions.englishTranslation: The faucet repaired by me is running again. - I'm proud of it.
questions.explanation: Participle II attribute (der von mir reparierte)

questions.question: Es ist ärgerlich, dass der Strom immer wieder ausfällt.
questions.englishTranslation: It's annoying that the power keeps going out. - I can't get the light fixed.
options: Ich bekomme das Licht nicht repariert.
questions.explanation: bekommen + Partizip II (passive alternative for detrimental actions)

questions.question: Solange ich hier wohne, wird das so bleiben.
questions.englishTranslation: As long as I live here, it will stay that way. - I won't change anything.
questions.explanation: Solange + present, future main clause

questions.question: Anstatt sich zu beschweren, könnte er selbst etwas tun.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of complaining, he could do something himself. - But he's lazy.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II modal

questions.question: Das Aufstehen früh am Morgen fällt mir schwer.
questions.englishTranslation: Getting up early in the morning is difficult for me. - I'm not an early riser.
questions.explanation: Nominalization of infinitive (das Aufstehen) as subject

questions.question: Wenn ich du wäre, würde ich die Wohnung wechseln.
questions.englishTranslation: If I were you, I would change apartments. - These neighbors are unbearable.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II irrealis (wenn ich du wäre)

questions.question: Der seit Wochen kaputte Kühlschrank stinkt.
questions.englishTranslation: The refrigerator broken for weeks stinks. - We finally have to get it repaired.
options: Wir müssen ihn endlich reparieren lassen.
questions.explanation: lassen + Infinitiv (arranging for action) + temporal attribute

questions.question: Ohne die Anleitung gelesen zu haben, baute er das Möbel zusammen.
questions.englishTranslation: Without having read the instructions, he assembled the furniture. - Of course something went wrong.
questions.explanation: Extended infinitive perfect (ohne...zu haben)

questions.question: Je mehr ich putze, desto schmutziger wird es.
questions.englishTranslation: The more I clean, the dirtier it gets. - That's frustrating.
questions.explanation: Je...desto comparison with verb endings

questions.question: Er tut so, als wäre er der Hausbesitzer.
questions.englishTranslation: He acts as if he were the homeowner. - But he's only a tenant.
questions.explanation: Als ob/wenn + Konjunktiv II of sein (wäre)

questions.question: Der über das Thema referierende Professor ist bekannt.
questions.englishTranslation: The professor lecturing on the topic is famous. - His lectures are always full.
questions.explanation: Participle I with extended object (über das Thema)

questions.question: Würdest du mir helfen, das Referat zu schreiben?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you help me write the presentation? - I can't manage it alone.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite request (würdest) + Infinitiv

questions.question: Nach dem Bestehen der Prüfung feierten wir lange.
questions.englishTranslation: After passing the exam, we celebrated for a long time. - We were so relieved.
questions.explanation: Nominalization after preposition (das Bestehen)

questions.question: Es ist schade, dass wir das Seminar nicht besuchen können.
questions.englishTranslation: It's a shame we can't attend the seminar. - It would have been very educational.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II in appositive clause

questions.question: Der von allen Studenten geliebte Dozent geht in Rente.
questions.englishTranslation: The lecturer loved by all students is retiring. - That's a great loss.
questions.explanation: Participle II with agent (von allen Studenten)

questions.question: Sobald ich die Note bekomme, fange ich an zu feiern.
questions.englishTranslation: As soon as I get the grade, I start celebrating. - I'm waiting impatiently for it.
questions.explanation: Sobald + present (future meaning), main clause present

questions.question: Anstatt zu lernen, würde er lieber feiern.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of studying, he would rather party. - But the exam is tomorrow.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II preference

questions.question: Das Lernen macht ihm keinen Spaß mehr.
questions.englishTranslation: Studying isn't fun for him anymore. - He has no motivation.
questions.explanation: Nominalization of infinitive with article

questions.question: Hätte ich das gewusst, hätte ich mich nicht angemeldet.
questions.englishTranslation: Had I known that, I wouldn't have registered. - The course is too hard.
options: Ich bin froh angemeldet zu sein.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II perfect conditional without wenn

questions.question: Der Professor lässt keine Sprechstunde ausfallen.
questions.englishTranslation: The professor doesn't let any office hour be cancelled. - He's always there punctually.
questions.explanation: lassen + Infinitiv (allowing/preventing)

questions.question: Es liegt auf der Hand, dass wir mehr lernen müssen.
questions.englishTranslation: It's obvious that we need to study more. - Otherwise we won't pass.
questions.explanation: Es liegt auf der Hand, dass... (fixed expression)

questions.question: Worüber sich die Studenten am meisten ärgern?
questions.englishTranslation: What annoys the students the most? - About the poor organization.
questions.explanation: Interrogative pronoun worüber + verb position

questions.question: Seitdem ich an der Uni bin, habe ich wenig geschlafen.
questions.englishTranslation: Since I've been at the university, I've slept little. - The studies demand a lot.
questions.explanation: Seitdem + present perfect, main clause present perfect

questions.question: Der mit einem Preis ausgezeichnete Wissenschaftler hält eine Vorlesung.
questions.englishTranslation: The scientist awarded with a prize is giving a lecture. - I absolutely want to hear him.
questions.explanation: Participle II with prepositional phrase (mit einem Preis)

questions.question: Es wäre besser gewesen, wenn wir früher angefangen hätten.
questions.englishTranslation: It would have been better if we had started earlier. - Now we have too little time.
options: Jetzt haben wir zu wenig Zeit.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II perfect (wäre gewesen) + past conditional

questions.question: Das in Deutschland hergestellte Auto ist teuer.
questions.englishTranslation: The car made in Germany is expensive. - But the quality is top.
questions.explanation: Participle II with local attribute (in Deutschland)

questions.question: Würden Sie mir einen Rabatt geben, wenn ich zehn Stück kaufe?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you give me a discount if I buy ten pieces? - That would be very nice.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II conditional (würden) with wenn

questions.question: Der von mir gekaufte Artikel ging nach zwei Tagen kaputt.
questions.englishTranslation: The item bought by me broke after two days. - I got my money back.
questions.explanation: Participle II with agent (von mir) + bekommen passive

questions.question: Anstatt teure Marken zu kaufen, könnte man Secondhand-Shoppen gehen.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of buying expensive brands, one could go secondhand shopping. - That's more sustainable.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II man-form

questions.question: Es lohnt sich, die Preise zu vergleichen.
questions.englishTranslation: It's worth comparing the prices. - You save a lot of money.
questions.explanation: Es lohnt sich, zu... (fixed expression)

questions.question: Hätte ich das Angebot nicht gesehen, hätte ich mehr bezahlt.
questions.englishTranslation: If I hadn't seen the offer, I would have paid more. - Lucky me!
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II irrealis perfect conditional

questions.question: Der mir empfohlene Laden hat tolle Sachen.
questions.englishTranslation: The shop recommended to me has great stuff. - I go there often.
questions.explanation: Participle II with dative object (mir empfohlene)

questions.question: Solange der Sale läuft, warte ich mit dem Kauf.
questions.englishTranslation: As long as the sale is running, I'll wait with the purchase. - Prices are dropping further.
questions.explanation: Solange + present, future main clause

questions.question: Es ist ärgerlich, dass die Ware nicht geliefert wird.
questions.englishTranslation: It's annoying that the goods aren't being delivered. - I never get them.
questions.explanation: bekommen + negation (never receiving)

questions.question: Würdest du mir helfen, das schwere Paket zu tragen?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you help me carry the heavy package? - It's very heavy.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite request

questions.question: Der von uns bestellte Tisch war leider besetzt.
questions.englishTranslation: The table ordered by us was unfortunately occupied. - We had to wait.
questions.explanation: Participle II with agent (von uns)

questions.question: Würden Sie mir die Speisekarte bringen, wenn Sie Zeit haben?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you bring me the menu if you have time? - Of course, right away.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite with conditional clause

questions.question: Es ist schade, dass das Essen kalt geworden ist.
questions.englishTranslation: It's a shame the food got cold. - The service was too slow.
questions.explanation: sein + Partizip II (Zustandspassiv/resultative)

questions.question: Anstatt zu beschweren, würde ich ein anderes Gericht bestellen.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of complaining, I would order another dish. - That's more constructive.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II advice

questions.question: Der kochende Koch schrie die Köche an.
questions.englishTranslation: The cooking chef yelled at the cooks. - It was stressful in the kitchen.
options: Es war stressig in der Küche.
questions.explanation: Participle I (kochende) describing ongoing action

questions.question: Hätte ich gewusst, dass es so lange dauert, wäre ich woanders essen gegangen.
questions.englishTranslation: Had I known it takes so long, I would have gone to eat elsewhere. - Now I'm hungry.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II perfect conditional complex

questions.question: Das Aufessen des Essens ist Pflicht.
questions.englishTranslation: Eating up the food is mandatory. - We have to eat everything up.
questions.explanation: Nominalization of separable verb (das Aufessen)

questions.question: Es lässt sich nicht vermeiden, dass man hier lange wartet.
questions.englishTranslation: It can't be avoided that you wait long here. - The restaurant is very popular.
questions.explanation: sich lassen + Infinitiv (impersonal) + dass clause

questions.question: Worauf freust du dich bei diesem Essen am meisten?
questions.englishTranslation: What are you looking forward to most at this meal? - The dessert.
questions.explanation: Interrogative worauf + verb position

questions.question: Der für uns reservierte Bereich ist sehr schön.
questions.englishTranslation: The area reserved for us is very nice. - We have a lot of space.
questions.explanation: Participle II with beneficiary (für uns)

questions.question: Wenn ich der Chef wäre, würde ich das Personal einstellen.
questions.englishTranslation: If I were the boss, I would hire more staff. - There are too few waiters.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II irrealis (wäre) + würde conditional

questions.question: Seitdem wir hier essen, sind wir Stammkunden.
questions.englishTranslation: Since we've been eating here, we're regulars. - The food is always excellent.
questions.explanation: Seitdem + present, main clause present

questions.question: Der von allen gelobte Nachtisch ist ausverkauft.
questions.englishTranslation: The dessert praised by everyone is sold out. - That's very annoying.
questions.explanation: Participle II with universal agent (von allen)

questions.question: Es wäre nett, wenn Sie mir die Rechnung bringen würden.
questions.englishTranslation: It would be nice if you would bring me the bill. - Unfortunately I have to go.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite with würde in subordinate clause

questions.question: Ohne das Trinkgeld gegeben zu haben, verließ er das Restaurant.
questions.englishTranslation: Without having given the tip, he left the restaurant. - That's very impolite.
questions.explanation: Extended infinitive perfect (ohne...zu haben) with zu before participle

questions.question: Der operierende Arzt ist sehr erfahren.
questions.englishTranslation: The operating doctor is very experienced. - I trust him completely.
questions.explanation: Participle I as attribute (operierende)

questions.question: Würden Sie mir sagen, wo es wehtut?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you tell me where it hurts? - There's a lot of pressure here.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite medical question

questions.question: Es ist wichtig, dass Sie die Medizin regelmäßig einnehmen.
questions.englishTranslation: It's important that you take the medicine regularly. - Otherwise it won't work.
questions.explanation: Noun clause with dass + modal sollen implication

questions.question: Hätte ich früher zum Arzt gegangen, wäre es nicht so schlimm.
questions.englishTranslation: If I had gone to the doctor earlier, it wouldn't be so bad. - Now I need an operation.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II irrealis past + present consequence

questions.question: Das Einnehmen der Tabletten ist essenziell.
questions.englishTranslation: Taking the tablets is essential. - Without them it won't get better.
options: Ohne sie wird es nicht besser.
questions.explanation: Nominalization of infinitive with article (das Einnehmen)

questions.question: Der von mir gewünschte Termin war nicht verfügbar.
questions.englishTranslation: The appointment wanted by me wasn't available. - I had to take another one.
questions.explanation: Participle II with subject (von mir gewünschte)

questions.question: Es lässt sich nicht vermeiden, dass es Nebenwirkungen gibt.
questions.englishTranslation: It can't be avoided that there are side effects. - But they're usually harmless.
questions.explanation: sich lassen + Infinitiv (impersonal) with dass clause

questions.question: Anstatt sich Sorgen zu machen, sollten Sie sich ausruhen.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of worrying, you should rest. - Stress is harmful to health.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II advice (sollten)

questions.question: Solange Sie Fieber haben, dürfen Sie nicht arbeiten.
questions.englishTranslation: As long as you have a fever, you may not work. - That's medically forbidden.
questions.explanation: Solange + present, modal main clause

questions.question: Der behandelnde Arzt verschreibt Antibiotika.
questions.englishTranslation: The treating doctor prescribes antibiotics. - I hope they help quickly.
questions.explanation: Participle I (behandelnde) describing professional role

questions.question: Das gebuchte Zimmer hat kein Fenster.
questions.englishTranslation: The booked room has no window. - I won't put up with that.
options: Das lasse ich mir nicht gefallen.
questions.explanation: Participle II as attribute (gebuchte) + lassen sich + Infinitiv

questions.question: Würden Sie mir einen besseren Platz zuweisen, wenn möglich?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you assign me a better place if possible? - I reserved a window seat.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite request with conditional

questions.question: Es ist ärgerlich, dass der Flug gestrichen wurde.
questions.englishTranslation: It's annoying that the flight was cancelled. - I'm not getting any compensation.
questions.explanation: bekommen + negation (not receiving)

questions.question: Hätten wir früher gebucht, würden wir jetzt weniger zahlen.
questions.englishTranslation: If we had booked earlier, we would pay less now. - Prices have risen.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II irrealis past + present conditional

questions.question: Der in der Broschüre beschriebene Strand ist verschmutzt.
questions.englishTranslation: The beach described in the brochure is polluted. - That's false advertising.
questions.explanation: Participle II with local prepositional phrase (in der Broschüre)

questions.question: Seitdem wir angekommen sind, regnet es.
questions.englishTranslation: Since we arrived, it's been raining. - The vacation is ruined.
questions.explanation: Seitdem + perfect, main clause present

questions.question: Es lohnt sich, den Reiseführer zu kaufen.
questions.englishTranslation: It's worth buying the travel guide. - It contains great tips.
questions.explanation: Es lohnt sich, zu... (value judgment)

questions.question: Der uns gegenüber sitzende Passagier ist laut.
questions.englishTranslation: The passenger sitting opposite us is loud. - Can we move seats?
questions.explanation: Participle I with local preposition (gegenüber sitzende)

questions.question: Anstatt zu fliegen, würde ich lieber mit dem Zug fahren.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of flying, I would rather take the train. - That's more environmentally friendly.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II preference (würde lieber)

questions.question: Das Gepäck lässt sich leider nicht ersetzen.
questions.englishTranslation: The luggage unfortunately can't be replaced. - It had high emotional value.
questions.explanation: sich lassen + negation (irreversible loss)

questions.question: Der den Unfall verursachende Fahrer flüchtete.
questions.englishTranslation: The driver causing the accident fled. - That's a criminal offense.
questions.explanation: Participle I with direct object (den Unfall verursachende)

questions.question: Würden Sie mir sagen, was genau passiert ist?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you tell me exactly what happened? - I want to document everything.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite official inquiry

questions.question: Es ist wichtig, dass Sie die Wahrheit sagen.
questions.englishTranslation: It's important that you tell the truth. - Lies have short legs (German proverb).
questions.explanation: Noun clause with dass + Konjunktiv I indirect speech

questions.question: Hätten Sie die Vorschriften beachtet, wäre das nicht passiert.
questions.englishTranslation: If you had observed the regulations, this wouldn't have happened. - That was your fault.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II perfect conditional (reproach)

questions.question: Der von der Polizei gesuchte Täter wurde gefasst.
questions.englishTranslation: The perpetrator sought by the police was caught. - That's a relief.
questions.explanation: Participle II with agent (von der Polizei) + passive perfect

questions.question: Es lässt sich nicht leugnen, dass Sie schuldig sind.
questions.englishTranslation: It can't be denied that you're guilty. - The evidence is clear.
questions.explanation: sich lassen + negation (undeniable fact) + dass clause

questions.question: Anstatt zu leugnen, sollten Sie gestehen.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of denying, you should confess. - That would be the best.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II advice (sollten)

questions.question: Seitdem das Gesetz geändert wurde, gibt es weniger Probleme.
questions.englishTranslation: Since the law was changed, there are fewer problems. - The reform was successful.
questions.explanation: Seitdem + passive perfect, main clause present

questions.question: Der die Unterschrift fälschende Beamte wurde entlassen.
questions.englishTranslation: The official falsifying the signature was dismissed. - He committed a crime.
questions.explanation: Participle I with object (die Unterschrift fälschende)

questions.question: Es wäre besser gewesen, wenn Sie einen Anwalt genommen hätten.
questions.englishTranslation: It would have been better if you had taken a lawyer. - Now it's too late.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II perfect (wäre gewesen) with past conditional

questions.question: Der uns allen bekannte Sänger gibt ein Konzert.
questions.englishTranslation: The singer known to us all is giving a concert. - We absolutely have to go.
questions.explanation: Participle II with dative plural (uns allen bekannte)

questions.question: Würdest du mir helfen, die Party zu organisieren?
questions.englishTranslation: Would you help me organize the party? - I can't manage it alone.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite request for help

questions.question: Es ist schade, dass er nicht kommen kann.
questions.englishTranslation: It's a shame he can't come. - Without him it's not the same.
options: Ohne ihn ist es nicht dasselbe.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II in noun clause (irrealis regret)

questions.question: Der die Witze erzählende Gast unterhielt alle.
questions.englishTranslation: The guest telling the jokes entertained everyone. - He was very funny.
questions.explanation: Participle I with direct object (die Witze erzählende)

questions.question: Hätten wir uns früher verabredet, hätten wir bessere Plätze.
questions.englishTranslation: If we had arranged to meet earlier, we would have better seats. - Now we have to sit in the back.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II irrealis past + present conditional

questions.question: Das gemeinsame Feiern macht am meisten Spaß.
questions.englishTranslation: Celebrating together is the most fun. - Alone it's boring.
questions.explanation: Nominalization with adjective (gemeinsame Feiern)

questions.question: Es lässt sich nicht vermeiden, dass wir uns manchmal streiten.
questions.englishTranslation: It can't be avoided that we sometimes argue. - But we always reconcile.
options: Aber wir versöhnen uns immer wieder.
questions.explanation: sich lassen + Infinitiv (unavoidable) + dass clause

questions.question: Anstatt zu streiten, könnten wir reden.
questions.englishTranslation: Instead of arguing, we could talk. - Communication is important.
questions.explanation: Anstatt...zu + Konjunktiv II suggestion (könnten)

questions.question: Seitdem wir befreundet sind, habe ich mich nie allein gefühlt.
questions.englishTranslation: Since we've been friends, I've never felt alone. - You're a good friend.
questions.explanation: Seitdem + perfect, main clause perfect

questions.question: Der von allen gemochte Kollege hat gekündigt.
questions.englishTranslation: The colleague liked by everyone has quit. - That's a great loss for the team.
options: Das ist ein großer Verlust fürs Team.
questions.explanation: Participle II with universal agent (von allen gemochte)

questions.question: Es wäre nett, wenn du mir schreiben würdest.
questions.englishTranslation: It would be nice if you would write to me. - I miss you.
questions.explanation: Konjunktiv II polite wish with würde in subordinate clause

questions.question: Ohne dich informiert zu haben, plante er die Überraschung.
questions.englishTranslation: Without having informed you, he planned the surprise. - That was mean.
questions.explanation: Extended infinitive perfect (ohne...zu haben) with prepositional object

questions.question: Der ständig lächelnde Kellner nervte uns.
questions.englishTranslation: The constantly smiling waiter annoyed us. - He didn't seem authentic.
questions.explanation: Participle I with frequency adverb (ständig lächelnde)

questions.question: Hätte ich nur auf dich gehört!
questions.englishTranslation: If only I had listened to you! - Then that wouldn't have happened.
questions.explanation: Elliptical Konjunktiv II wish (omitted main clause conditional)

questions.question: Es ist wichtig, dass wir uns regelmäßig treffen.
questions.englishTranslation: It's important that we meet regularly. - Otherwise we'll lose contact.
questions.explanation: Noun clause with dass + Konjunktiv I (indirect command)
